Class DefinitionType

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Gml.Dictionary
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

The DefinitionType specifies a definition, which can be included in or referenced by a dictionary. The content model for a generic definition is a derivation from AbstractGMLType.

  • The Description property shall hold the definition if this can be captured in a simple text string.
  • The DescriptionReference property may carry a link to a description elsewhere.
  • The Identifier property shall provide one identifier identifying this definition.
  • The Identifier property shall be unique within the dictionaries using this definition.
  • The Name property shall provide zero or more terms and synonyms for which this is the definition.

The Remarks property shall be used to hold additional textual information that is not conceptually part of the definition but is useful in understanding the definition. 

[IsoType("DefinitionType", IsoType = IsoTypes.ComplexType)]
[JsonObject("DefinitionType")]
public class DefinitionType : DefinitionBaseType, IModel, IObservableModel, INotifyPropertyChanged, IDbId, IStandardObjectProperties, IId

Properties

Remarks

Provides additional textual information that is not conceptually part of the definition but is useful for understanding it.

[JsonProperty("remarks", Order = 0)]
public string? Remarks { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Examples

Example of setting remarks for a GML Definition:

var definition = new DefinitionType {
  Identifier = new CodeWithAuthorityType {
    Code = "EPSG:4326",
    Authority = "EPSG"
  },
  Remarks = "Commonly used for WGS 84 coordinate reference system."
};

Remarks

  • The Remarks property can be used to store notes, clarifications, or usage guidelines related to this definition.
  • Unlike the description, which provides a formal definition, remarks are meant to provide supporting or contextual information.
